alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 14 at 8:56PM EDT until August 14 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Claiborne County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Hawkins County in east Tennessee... Hancock County in east Tennessee... South central Lee County in southwestern Virginia... * Until 945 PM EDT. * At 855 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Sneedville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Sneedville, Howard Quarter, Evanston, Kyles Ford, and Klondike. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
